children.value: Welcome to the documentation of Chakra UI Vue. Here you can find more about Chakra UI Vue, what it is, how it can help you build applications, explore the components and theme, etc.
Chakra UI Vue is a design system implementation that allows you to build applications and design systems with
. Chakra UI Vue comes with a list of
, like a button, accordion component, etc. All the components are build with accessibility in mind and will ship with the needed
Chakra UI Vue also comes with a default
, with colors, sizes, component styles, to get you started. But allows for a fully customization to make your application look exactly as you want it, thanks to the
Chakra UI Vue is build for

is a design system implementation whose mission is to make building accessible
and composable Vue.js web applications fun.

In order to make our components as accessible as possible, we've carefully crafted each component
to be WAI-ARIA compliant while still making it possible to customize Chakra components based on
constraint-based design principles.

Chakra UI Vue is able to do this because of principles adopted from patterns in the web development space
that proved to be successful. We've borrowed tons of knowledge and inspiration from React's
from the folks over at React Training, and many other tools that make web development a colorful field.
Chakra UI is built from the ground up with two main guiding principles in mind:
Provide accessible components out of the box.
Bridge the gap between design and development, by providing a styling API that utilizes constraint-based design principles.
Provide composable components that consumers can extend to create their own custom components.
Find new ways to make building accessible Vue applications fun and fast.
To get started, you can use the

props.style: width:100%; height:500px; border:10px; border-color: black; border-radius: 4px; overflow:hidden;

props.allow: accelerometer; ambient-light-sensor; camera; encrypted-media; geolocation; gyroscope; hid; microphone; midi; payment; usb; vr; xr-spatial-tracking

contents.title: Installation
contents.description: How to install and set up Chakra UI in your project

children.value: Getting Started with Chakra UI Vue
Please note that our docs are still under development.
Let's see how you can get started with

project. Don't worry, this can be a new or existing project.
If you are looking to install
The first thing you will need to do is install the

package and its dependencies in the Vue project.
This can be achieved with the following terminal command:
Or if you prefer using yarn:

Perfect, now before you can use the features of Chakra UI, you will have to add it to the app instance.
For this, you have to import the

file.
This allows you to create the
plugin instance and will make it easy to add plugin options like

for example.
Then you need to tell the application that you want to use the plugin, this will make the Chakra UI Vue features available to use in your Vue app.
This will also be the place where you can add extra

to the Chakra UI Vue plugin to extend Chakra's features for the application.
But let's not dive into that yet, let's first see how you can use Chakra UI Components. An overview of all the components can be found here.

Once you've installed and imported Chakra UI Vue, you can start using its components in your app.
Let's pick the

from the package.
(Note the use of the
Next, you want to display the button on the page. After it is imported, the button will be available in the template.
You have a working button with some styling. Thanks to styled props, you can style

components.
Like you did here with our button, making it use the

color scheme.
Let's learn about styled props and the theming API of Chakra UI Vue here.

contents.title: Using Nuxt
contents.description: How to use Chakra UI Vue with Nuxt

children.value: ! Getting started with Chakra UI Nuxt is also just as simple.
If you wish to use Chakra UI Vue with Nuxt, you will have to install the
package. This package will install all the required dependencies.
We then register the Chakra UI module in the¬†
See the Nuxt documentation to learn more about modules in Nuxt.js
Chakra module options are the same as the Vue CLI plugin options. Learn more about the¬†
* Add extend the plugin options under the `chakra` key.

That is it! üöÄ
You can now use the Chakra UI components and features in your Nuxt application.
Here is a Nuxt 3 Github repo that contains a starter for Chakra UI Nuxt:

contents.title: Design Principles
contents.description: Principles that keeps Chakra's components fairly consistent

children.value:
Chakra UI Vue is established on principles that keep its components fairly
consistent. Understanding these concepts will help you better contribute to
Chakra UI Vue.

Our goal is to design simple, composable components that cater to real-life UI
design problems. In order to do that, we developed a set of principles that help
us always be on that path.

All component styles can be overridden or extended via style
props to reduce the use of

Strive to keep the component API fairly simple and show real
world scenarios of using the component.

Break down components into smaller parts with minimal props
to keep complexity low, and compose them together. This will ensure that the
styles and functionality are flexible and extensible.

When creating a component, keep accessibility top of mind.
This includes keyboard navigation, focus management, color contrast, voice
over, and the correct
Make components dark mode compatible. Use

We all know naming is the hardest thing in this industry.
Generally, ensure a prop name is indicative of what it does. Boolean props
should be named using auxiliary verbs such as

contents.title: Styled System
contents.description: Introduction to Styled System of Chakra UI Vue

children.value: The styled system of Chakra UI Vue helps you to take care of anything style related.

In order to help you create clean, consistent layouts, Chakra UI Vue provides building blocks that take
advantage of
Chakra UI Vue's design principles are built around two core concepts:

are named values that are
used in place of hard-coded values (such as hex values for color or pixel values for spacing)
in order to maintain a scalable and consistent visual system for UI development.
These constraints help you to create consistent, high-quality user interfaces.

Chakra UI Vue's theming system leverages design tokens for different style properties
like color, spacing, font sizes, font weights, opacity, radii, shadows, z-indices, border widths, and breakpoints.

This allows us to create a system that enables us to style our applications in ways that can be scaled
across different scales. These include a typographic (
By default Chakra UI Vue uses the

Because Chakra UI Vue uses styled system under the hood, it allows you to reliably create consistent
spacing of elements in your applications. The
key can directly be referenced by
By default, Chakra UI Vue uses a comprehensive

as a single unit. So in order to apply a
padding of
Below are some examples of how to apply spacing values to Chakra components.
Chakra UI Vue's default space scale uses
as the CSS unit which is relative to the default root HTML font size of 16px

By default, Chakra UI Vue uses a theme object that you can extend and customize as you see fit for your application.
To learn more about theming in Chakra UI Vue, check out the

contents.title: Style Props
contents.description: Learn how to use style props in Chakra UI. Style props are a way to alter the style of a component by simply passing props to it

children.value:
Style props are a way to alter the style of a component by simply passing props
to it. It helps to save time by providing helpful shorthand ways to style
components.

The following table shows a list of every style prop and the properties within
each group.

contents.title: Responsive Styles
contents.description: Chakra UI Vue supports responsive styles out of the box

children.value: Chakra UI Vue supports responsive styles out of the box. Instead of manually adding

queries and adding nested styles throughout your code, Chakra UI Vue allows
you to provide object and array values to add mobile-first responsive styles.

media query to ensure your interfaces are
mobile-first.

Responsive syntax relies on the breakpoints defined in the theme object. Chakra
UI Vue provides default breakpoints, here's what it looks like:
To make styles responsive, you can use either the array or object syntax.

All style props accept arrays as values for mobile-first responsive styles. This
is the recommended method.

responsive using the array syntax, here's what you
need to do:
To interpret array responsive values, Chakra UI Vue converts the values defined in

and sorts them in ascending order. Afterward, we map the
values defined in the array to the breakpoints
Here's how to interpret this syntax:
To skip certain breakpoints, you can pass

to any position in the array
to avoid generating unnecessary CSS.

You can also define responsive values with breakpoint aliases in an object. Any
undefined alias key will define the base, non-responsive value.

responsive using the object syntax, here's what you need
to do:
Remember, Chakra UI Vue uses the min-width media query for responsive design
Here's how to interpret this syntax:

This works for every style prop in the theme specification, which means you can
change the style of most properties at a given breakpoint.

This shortcut is an alternative to writing media queries out by hand. Given the
following:
It'll generate a CSS that looks like this
The equivalent of this style if you passed it as an object.

In some scenarios, you might need to define custom breakpoints for your
application. We recommended using common aliases like
To define custom breakpoints, just pass them as an object into the theme.
Note: Ensure the css unit of your breakpoints are the same. Use all

Getting a new business off the ground is a lot of hard work. Here are five

An accordion is a vertically stacked set of interactive headings containing a title, content snippet, or thumbnail representing a section of content.
Chakra UI Vue exports 5 accordion-related components.
: The wrapper that contains accordion items.
: The button that toggles the expand/collapse state of the accordion item. This button must be wrapped in an element with role heading.
: The container for the details to be revealed.
: A chevron-down icon that rotates based on the expanded/collapsed state
By default, only one item may be expanded and it can only be collapsed again by expanding another.
supports keyboard navigation between accordion buttons. Pressing the
key will move focus between accordion buttons.
then the accordion will permit multiple items to be expanded at once.
, any expanded item may be collapsed again.
depending on the state of the
when focus is on the accordion panel header will toggle (expand or collapse) the accordion.
Alert component displays a short important message such as error message, warning message, success message or other prompt notifications.
This package exports the following alert components
: The alert container which wraps the entire alert components.

: The description component is used to pass the alert message.
: The alert Icon component can be used to define the seevrity of an alert.

Breadcrumbs is a navigation pattern that helps users understand the hierarchy and organization of the website's content. They appear top of a web page, and display the successive paths a user on a web page. They are clickable links that represent preceeding pages to a current web page.
: The parent container for breadcrumbs component.
: Individual breadcrumb element containing a link and a divider.
: The separator between eac breadcrumb item. Usualy an icon, string, chevron and others.
that it represents the current page.
Breadcrumb separators can be used in four ways, either as default separator, with separator as string, with separator props as functional component, and with separator slot.
You can easily style and customize the breadcrumb by passing styles props to the
component. The example below is giving color and fontsize to the breadcrumb.
with the vue-router by passing the
prop adds the aria-current=page to the
The CBreadcrumb separators define the direction of the breadcrumb trail.

: The button component with support for other features like icons, and spinners.

props to set an onClick action.
component to group buttons. When you use the ButtonGroup component, it allows you to:
Set the size and variant of all buttons within it.
Flush the buttons together by removing the border radius of their children as needed.
When Button has focus, Space or Enter activates it.
etc are converted to style props. This therefore means you can override any style of the Button via props.
You can pass-in other props to make fully customizable buttons, you can do this easily by defining each props based on your button composition.

Spacer: Creates an adjustable, empty space that can be used to tune the spacing between child elements within Flex.
When using the Flex component, you can use some of the following helpful shorthand props:
While you can pass the verbose props, using the shorthand can save you some time.
to create stackable and responsive layouts.
Flex and Spacer vs Grid vs Stack
treat children of different widths differently.
, the children will have equal spacing between them but they won't span the entire width of the container.
, the starting points of the children will be equally spaced but the gaps between them will not be equal.
, the children will span the entire width of the container and also have equal spacing between them.
Flex and Spacer: Full width, equal Spacing
Grid: The children start at the beginning, the 1/3 mark and 2/3 mark
HStack: The children have equal spacing but don't span the whole container

The Image component is used to display images with support for fallback.
The size of the image can be adjusted using the
The Image component allows you provide a fallback placeholder. The placeholder is displayed when:
An error occurred while loading the image
You can also opt out of this behavior by passing the ignoreFallback prop.
The path to the image source
In event there was an error loading the

Tag component is used for items that need to be labeled, categorized, or organized using keywords that describe them.
This package exports the following components :
: The wrapper for all the tag elements.
: The label for tag's text content.
: The icon placed on the left side of the tag.
: The icon placed on the right side of the tag.
: The close button for the tag.
Wrap is a layout component used to add space between elements and wraps automatically if there isn't enough space.
Wrap: Wrap composes the Box component and renders a

box container that can wrap its children onto multiple lines with
support. It is useful for displaying elements that are typically placed side-by-side, such as dialog buttons, tags, and chips.

component wraps to the next line because there is not enough space to fit it on the same line as the other Box components.
